intro: Primula atricapilla, commonly known as the black-capped primrose, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe. It is characterized by its dark purple to almost black flowers, which bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are arranged in a raceme and are often visited by bees and other pollinators. Primula atricapilla prefers well-drained, calcareous soils and is often found in rocky or grassy habitats.
